poem:
### A Moron's Morning  
In the paper's shuffle, words tangle,  
Navarro, in a suit of calm deflects—  
"Great," he says, sun rising behind him,  
as if insults were morning coffee,  
brewed bitter but taken with a grin—  
A billionaire's quip floats away like smoke,  
leaving the day undisturbed, unshaken.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump adviser Peter Navarro says ‘we’re great’ after Elon Musk calls him ‘moron’ Peter Navarro, a top trade adviser to Donald Trump, said he and Elon Musk are “great” after the president’s multi-billionaire business adviser publicly called him “a moron” who was “dumber than a sack of bricks”. “I’ve been called worse,” Navarro said Sunday on NBC’s Meet the Press in some of his most extensive remarks about the insults Musk directed at him days". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Trump adviser Peter Navarro says ‘we’re great’ after Elon Musk calls him ‘moron’ Peter Navarro, a top trade adviser to Donald Trump, said he and Elon Musk are “great” after the president’s multi-billionaire business adviser publicly called him “a moron” who was “dumber than a sack of bricks”. “I’ve been called worse,” Navarro said Sunday on NBC’s Meet the Press in some of his most extensive remarks about the insults Musk directed at him days
